channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Amid power outages, an unusual number of locals visit Nashville's honky tonk district
item.description: While winter storms caused major power outages in Nashville, its downtown music scene saw a lot more locals who took up hotel rooms usually occupied by tourists.
item.content:encoded: While winter storms caused major power outages in Nashville, its downtown music scene saw a lot more locals who took up hotel rooms usually occupied by tourists.
item.dc:creator: Justin Barney

item.title: An uneasy détente: Trump and Colombia's Petro to meet at White House
item.description: Donald Trump and Gustavo Petro share little in common — except a talent for confrontation. Their meeting at the White House on Tuesday could reshape U.S.–Colombia relations.
item.content:encoded:
Donald Trump and Gustavo Petro share little in common — except a talent for confrontation. Their meeting at the White House on Tuesday could reshape U.S.–Colombia relations.

(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds, Raul Arboleda)
item.dc:creator: John Otis

item.title: Scientists release a map of the clearest picture yet of what dark matter looks like
item.description: Dark matter makes up most of the universe, yet we have very little understanding of it. Scientists recently released a map that gives the clearest picture yet of what dark matter looks like.
item.content:encoded: Dark matter makes up most of the universe, yet we have very little understanding of it. Scientists recently released a map that gives the clearest picture yet of what dark matter looks like.
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: The method for estimating a dinosaurs' age at death may be off, research suggests
item.description: A growing body of research on dinosaurs' closest living relatives suggests the method that's been used to estimate how old a dinosaur was when it died may be leading paleontologists astray.
item.content:encoded: A growing body of research on dinosaurs' closest living relatives suggests the method that's been used to estimate how old a dinosaur was when it died may be leading paleontologists astray.
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: What we know about the contents of the recent release of Epstein files
item.description: More than 3 million newly-released pages of the Epstein files show more about the life and relationships of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. They also contain unredacted names of his accusers.
item.content:encoded: More than 3 million newly-released pages of the Epstein files show more about the life and relationships of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. They also contain unredacted names of his accusers.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: How state officials are taking action against federal agents
item.description: In the wake of Minnesota, several Democratic-led states are looking for ways to limit immigration agents' activities. Some Republican-led states are ordering local governments to cooperate with them.
item.content:encoded: In the wake of Minnesota, several Democratic-led states are looking for ways to limit immigration agents' activities. Some Republican-led states are ordering local governments to cooperate with them.
item.dc:creator: Mawa Iqbal

item.title: Bad Bunny made history taking home the Grammy for album of the year
item.description: Bad Bunny made history Sunday night at the Grammys, taking home the most coveted prize: album of the year.
item.content:encoded: Bad Bunny made history Sunday night at the Grammys, taking home the most coveted prize: album of the year.
item.dc:creator: Anamaria Artemisa Sayre

item.title: In her last Olympic season, US cross-country ski phenom Jessie Diggins looks stronger than ever
item.description: Jessie Diggins, age 34, helped break an Olympic medal drought for American cross-country skiers that dated back to the 1970s. In her final season, she enters the Milan Cortina Olympics on a winning streak and with new peace of mind.
item.content:encoded:
Jessie Diggins, age 34, helped break an Olympic medal drought for American cross-country skiers that dated back to the 1970s. In her final season, she enters the Milan Cortina Olympics on a winning streak and with new peace of mind.

(Image credit: Federico Modica)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Kilmar Abrego Garcia has become a symbol of the pitfalls of immigration enforcement
item.description: Immigration attorneys and advocates see Kilmar Abrego Garcia's case as a symbol of the bigger travails of mass deportation.
item.content:encoded: Immigration attorneys and advocates see Kilmar Abrego Garcia's case as a symbol of the bigger travails of mass deportation.
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Opening of Rafah crossing is just the start of a massive undertaking to rebuild Gaza
item.description: Gaza's key border crossing with Egypt opened briefly for the first time in a year. Only a handful Palestinians were able to leave, but it's an important step in an undertaking to rebuild Gaza.
item.content:encoded: Gaza's key border crossing with Egypt opened briefly for the first time in a year. Only a handful Palestinians were able to leave, but it's an important step in an undertaking to rebuild Gaza.
item.dc:creator: Michele Kelemen
